edu.calstatela.sawooope.entity

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.calstatela.sawooope.entity.Animation

  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    Animation uses sprites passed in by entities to create animations. It simply takes in an array of images (frames) and flips through each image in the array at certain time intervals. Each image in the array is a frame.
    Author:
    Benji

      • setFrames

        public void setFrames(Bitmap[] frames)
        Sets the animation using the images passed in
        Parameters:
        frames - images that represent a single animation

      • getCurrAction

        public int getCurrAction()
        Returns:
        if the entity is using an ArrayList to set the animation frames then it returns the index used to set the sprites other wise -1 is returned

      • setFrames

        public void setFrames(java.util.ArrayList<Bitmap[]> sprites,
             int index)
        Sets the animation using the images passed in
        Parameters:
        sprites - list of frames
        index - index of the list of frames being used

      • resetCurrentAction

        public void resetCurrentAction()
        sets the actionIndex to -1 signifying that there is no action index

      • setDelay

        public void setDelay(long d)
        Sets how much time must past before the next frame (image) in the animation is displayed
        Parameters:
        d - time in milliseconds

      • setFrame

        public void setFrame(int frameSet)
        Sets the current frame to the specified value
        Parameters:
        frameSet - frame number

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the animations based on the set frames

      • getCurrentFrame

        Returns:

      • getImage

        public Bitmap getImage()
        Returns:
        the image in the current frame

      • hasPlayedOnce

        public boolean hasPlayedOnce()
        Returns:
        true if the animation has cycled through 1 or more times
